title: U.S. News:  Biden To Increase  J&J Dose Supply  ----  By Sabrina Siddiqui
text:
President Biden directed his administration to secure an additional 100 million doses of Johnson & Johnson's Covid-19 vaccine by year-end and said he planned to share any excess vaccine supply with other nations.

If an agreement with J&J is completed, the additional supply would double the company's previous commitment to provide 100 million doses to the U.S.

Taking into account commitments by Pfizer Inc. and Moderna Inc. to provide 600 million doses of their two-shot vaccines, the U.S. is expected to have more than enough supply by the end of May to vaccinate the eligible U.S. population, Mr. Biden said.

"We need maximum flexibility. There's always a chance we'll encounter unexpected challenges," Mr. Biden said of his additional intended purchases on Wednesday, following a meeting at the White House with J&J Chief Executive Alex Gorsky and Merck & Co. Inc. CEO Kenneth Frazier.
